intro: Delphinium canmorcnse, commonly known as the alpine larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, spindly stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture, and its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Delphinium canmorcnse is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
